node.text:
LEAF PAINTING 🍁🍂🍃🌿- I’m reposting this fun LIVE I did with @mastermindtoys on Friday because there are so many fun leaf painting techniques! And I love that you can use so many different kinds of paint and supplies to make beautiful art 🤩 Sorry the sound is a little off 🙈 the Lives can do that. Let me know in the comments below if you guys would like to see more craft and art tutorial lives! ❤️
.
.
Here’s what you need:
-Leaves 🍂🍁🌿
-Paint - we used watercolors, acrylic and puffy paint (special thanks to @colormadehappy for the puffy paint idea)
-White cardstock 
.
.
For the full post head to thebestideasforkids.com and search “Leaf Painting” or head to: https://www.thebestideasforkids.com/leaf-painting/
.
.
Follow us at @bestideasforkids for more fun kids crafts and activities 🌈 🎨 
.
.
For the giveaway by @mastermindtoys this is open to Canadian residents 18+. This giveaway is not affiliated or endorsed by Instagram. 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

CLOTHESPIN SCARECROWS 🌾 🧡💙
Say hello to these cute little guys that also stand up with the clothespins (swipe 👉 to see them standing)! 😍🍂

This is a fun shape activity for kids too. 🟠🟦🟧🔵

Make your own shapes or grab the template on the post if you want help tracing the design. 🤩 ✏️ 🌈

You can get the template on the post, at thebestideasforkids.com and search “Scarecrow Craft”. 
.
For more fun crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 
.

node.text:
WATERCOLOR GEOMETRIC LEAVES 🍃 🍂🍁
I guess I’m loving watercolors lately 😍 Head to my feed to see the latest painting with leaves 🍃 that use watercolors too. 🎨 

Want to know the best part about painting with watercolors? They are so much easier to clean up. 🙌 Really, 😎 because they’re already water based the clean-up is so simple. And if you use a washable, kid-friendly brand than it’s even better. The results turn out great when using kids washable watercolors unlike some washable paint that can go on almost transparent-like. 

Did you see the dinosaur 🦕 🦖 versions like these? They were such a hit I decided to make a fall version (thank you to a reader for the inspiration 🤩).

This easy watercolor art project can be done by kids of all ages! And if you don’t have watercolor paints, kids can even just color in the shapes with crayons. To make it easier for younger kids, skip the crayon step. 

What other themes like this would you like to see? Let me know down below and also tag someone you think might like to try this art!

Here’s what you need:
Watercolor paints 🎨 
White cardstock 📄 
Black crayon or black oil pastel 🖍 
Leaf templates 🍂🍃- you can get them on the post at thebestideasforkids.com

Directions:
Have kids outline the template with a black crayon.
Paint the shapes inside with watercolors. 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and activity ideas. 🖍✂️
.
Save this post for later by clicking the flag 🏳️at the bottom of the post ❤️
.
.
. 
.

node.text:
WATERCOLOR LEAF PAINTING 🍃 🍁 🍂 
Here’s a simple but beautiful way to make leaf art with kids!
Add a few different watercolors to the vein side of a leaf. Press onto cardstock or watercolor paper.
This makes the prettiest leaf art 😍🍃🍂
Kids of all ages can do this! 
And if you haven’t tried the classic crayon rub🖍 leaf art, try this 👉 place the leaf under a piece of paper and rub a crayon on top. 

For more crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
SIDEWALK CHALK PAINT 🎨 🌈🤩
Making your own sidewalk chalk paint is easy - and a perfect use for all of the little bits and pieces that are too hard to draw with! 🙌

Follow me @bestideasforkids for more fun crafts and activities! 🌈 

Ingredients
* 	2 tbsp cornstarch
* 	2 tbsp water If not painting well enough, add 1 extra tablespoon of water and mix in
* 	1/2 tbsp sidewalk chalk Or approx 1/4 to 1/2 a piece of chalk 

Add 2 tablespoons of cornstarch into a measuring cup.

Add 2 tablespoons of water into the cup and mix. Note: if you find the paint does not paint well, add an additional tablespoon of water.

Grate sidewalk chalk to get approx 1/2 tablespoon of chalk. Add it into the cup or the muffin tin and then mix with the cornstarch and water. 

If you would rather not grate the chalk, place the chalk pieces into a ziploc bag and bang with a rolling pin until it turns into a similar consistency.

Repeat for each color you'd like to make.

This sidewalk chalk paint will make one muffin cup of paint. If you want to fill your muffin tin you will need to repeat the recipe for each color.
You can also double or triple the recipe and make a larger batch and then split it into smaller containers and add the sidewalk chalk in last to save time.

Save this post for later  and tag a friend that might like to try it! ❤️
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and recipe ideas. 🖍✂️ .

PAPER CRAYON CARDS🖍 🌈

These little crayon 🖍 cuties can be used as a fun back to school 🏫 about me activity (what’s your favorite color?), bulletin board decor or a writing prompt to go with The Day the Crayons 🖍 Quit book. You can also leave the inside blank and use it however you’d like!

✏️ Should I make a matching pencil? 🤔 

There’s a printable template available too (right on the post) if you want help tracing the design. 🤩🖍🌈 

You can get the template on the post, at thebestideasforkids.com and search “Crayon Template”. 
.
For more fun crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials.

TOILET PAPER ROLL PENCILS ✏️ ✏️ 
These little pencil cuties were inspired by the crayons I made (swipe 👉) to see the crayons 🖍 too 😍
✏️ 
If you’ve been following for awhile, you know I love a good toilet paper roll craft 🤩 These cute pencils would make a fun gift for a teacher or look adorable placed in an office. 

There’s a printable template available too if you want help tracing the design. 🤩

You can get the template on the post, at thebestideasforkids.com and search “Toilet Paper Roll Pencil”. 

Here’s what you need:
-Toilet Paper Roll
-Colored Cardstock - yellow, pink, black, cream
-Tin foil
-Googly eyes
-Black Marker

For more fun recycled ♻️ crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 
.

node.text:
EGG CARTON GARDEN 🌻🌼🌸🌻 
Reminiscing about my first book while I’m working on book #2 right now. ☺️ Do you have a copy of my book?
This egg carton garden is one of my favorites. A cute little activity where you can build your own flower garden 🌻 with just some paper, popsicle sticks and an egg carton.

Book #2 is going to be recycled crafts but with a little twist to make crafting easier. 😍
I can’t wait to share the final book with you guys! 

Here’s what you need to make the egg carton garden: 
– 18 count or 12 count egg carton (the 18 count will allow you to make 2 rows of flowers)
– Colored buttons
– Cardstock – we used green, pink, purple, red and yellow
– Acrylic paint – we used green for the popsicle sticks and egg carton
– 10 popsicle sticks
-Flower templates (in my book)
– Extra strong glue

For more fun crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️
.
.

node.text:
LEAF SALT PAINTING 🧂 🍁 🍂 
When you’re in a pinch ✨ for a quick and fun activity, salt painting is my go to 👌. You only need glue, salt and paint. 🎨 

I have some tips on the post for doing salt painting and you can grab the leaf template too (grab them on the post by searching leaf salt painting 🍂🍁 on thebestideasforkids.com ⭐️)
.
For more fun crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️
.

node.text:
PAPER ROLL HANDPRINT TREE 🌳 
Who is ready for Fall? 🍁🍂🍁🍂🍁

I love this simple handprint craft. You only need a few supplies like some paper, paint and a paper roll. 😍

This would also look so pretty as a table centrepiece too. Kids will also love finding sticks and pine cones to decorate their tree 🌳❤️
.
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and activity ideas. 🖍✂️
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

.

node.text:
SAND SLIME 💙💜
If you like kinetic sand 🏖 and you like slime then you’ll love this sand slime 🤩
.
Here’s what you need:
-Colored Sand
-Elmer’s Clear Glue (6 Oz)
-Baking Soda (1/2 teaspoon)
-1/4 cup Water 💧 
-1.5 tablespoons Contact solution (we use Renu brand and it must contain boric acid for it to work)

How to make it:
1. Add 6 oz of clear glue to a bowl.
2. Add 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda and mix. Don’t over mix at this step or too many bubbles will form in the clear glue.
3. Add 1/4 cup of water. And mix gently (to not create too many bubbles again).
4. Add 1 cup of sand to the bowl.
5. Add 1 tablespoon of contact solution to start and mix. Then add 1/2 tablespoon more and mix until it starts to come off of the sides of the bowl.
6. Take the slime out and knead until it’s not sticky anymore. It will be really sticky to start but if you keep kneading it will turn into the perfect consistency. You can also put some baby oil or lotion on your hands to help with the stickiness at this point. Do not add extra contact solution or it will get too hard.
.
*Make sure to read the full blog post before making it for all of tips and safety info. 
.
Follow us at @bestideasforkids for more fun kids crafts and activities 🌈 🎨 .
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
COLOR CHANGING FLOWERS EXPERIMENT 🌼🌸❤️🧡💛💚💙💜 
Swipe 👉 to see a really cool time lapse 🤩

Kids will be amazed to see flowers turn into any color of the rainbow. 🌈 This science experiment is a fun one to learn about capillary action. 💦 

Here’s what you need: 
- White Daisies (florist bought as wild daisy stems are too thin and the flowers are more prone to wilting) – you can also use Gerbera daisies or another variety of white flower

-Mini Jars or small mason jars

-1/2 Cup Of Water For Each Jar 💦 

-Food Coloring – we like to use concentrated food coloring because it will give you more vibrant colors.

Instructions

1. Start with at least 6 white flowers (if you want to do each color). Use fresh florist bought daisies, gerbera daisies, chrysanthemums or roses.

Wild flowers will still work but you won’t get the same effect of color and they are more prone to wilt because their stems are not as hardy.

2.  Trim the stem off of the flower on an angle so that it can “drink” the water more easily and quickly. Fresh flowers are best.

3. Add 1/2 cup of water to each jar.

4. Add around 10 drops of food coloring to each jar and stir. We experimented with red, orange, yellow, green, blue and purple food coloring.
Concentrated food coloring will give you a more vibrant flower result.

5. Add at least one white flower to each jar of colored water.

6. The flowers should start changing within one hour. Leave overnight or even for a few days to get the most color.
Note: purple is a color that will not transfer well. It will be very faint or it may end up looking more red or blue.

Don’t forget to save this post for later and tag someone you think might like this idea ❤️

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and recipe ideas. 🖍✂️

node.text:
RAINBOW 🌈 RAIN CLOUD ☁️ IN A JAR 🌧 
Learn about clouds ☁️ with this colorful 🌈 rainbow in a jar experiment. 

Here’s what you need: 
- Concentrated food coloring
- Water 💦 
- Shaving Cream
- A Clear Jar 

Instructions
1. Add a few drops of food coloring gel for each color (red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple) into a small bowl for each color. Add a little bit of water to dilute it, but not too much to keep the colors vibrant. Add a pipette into each bowl of food coloring. You can also do this with just blue to make it look more like rain 🌧 

2. Fill your vase or mason jar about 3/4 full of water.

3. Add shaving cream on top.

4. Now you can start dropping your “raindrops” into the vase or jar. The drops will slowly make their way through the “clouds” into the water. If you find they are not dropping down, you can also push the pipette a little bit more into the shaving cream (but be careful not to push too far or you’ll end up in the water).

In this experiment, the clouds are the shaving cream and the food colored water is the rain. As you drop the colored water into the cloud the weight of the water forces itself through the cloud to “rain” down into the jar.

Don’t forget to save this post for later and tag someone you think might like this idea ❤️

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and recipe ideas. 🖍✂️
